description.narrative: Brunswick Rail Holding Limited (BRHL or the Company) is a leasing company providing freight railcars to corporate clients in the Russian Federation. It generally provides the railcars on an operating lease basis (where the residual value of the railcars remains with BRHL). It is a wholly owned subsidiary of Brunswick Rail (Brunswick or the Group), one of the largest privately-owned freight railcar leasing companies active in the Russian Federation with a fleet of over 22,000 railcars. The Group is looking to expand its fleet to optimize its operations and achieve the critical mass it needs to thrive in the sector. IFC has previously provided two loans to this Company and has recently provided a loan to another subsidiary of the Group (Brunswick Wagon Leasing) and has an equity stake in Brunswick.

The Project would: (i) support the continued development of a key private sector player in the relatively new Russian railcar leasing sector; (ii) contribute to the development of the transportation and logistics sectors in the Russian Federation, facilitating economic growth particularly in the economically disadvantaged hinterland; and (iii) facilitate a Eurobond issue which will be used to finance the construction of additional railcars and help avoid a supply crisis over the next 5-10 years as the majority of RZhD''s fleet reaches the end of its useful life. The majority of the Group''s fleet is unrelated to the oil sector and thus helps facilitate the diversification of the economy. Brunswick''s new, more reliable railcars also help mitigate the risk of trucking replacing railways which would result in an increase of harmful greenhouse gases.
